question_sentence: Which NFL teams are headed to the Super Bowl on February 12?
evidence: The Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs will face off in Super Bowl LVII.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden intends to end the Covid-19 national and public health emergencies in which month of this year?
evidence: Biden intends to end the Covid-19 national and public health emergencies on May 11, the White House said Monday. That means that many Americans could have to start paying for Covid-19 testing and treatment after the declarations cease.

question_sentence: Which state has been bearing the brunt of a dangerous ice storm this week?
evidence: A combination of treacherous wintry conditions in Texas caused power outages for more than 400,000 homes and businesses, according to PowerOutage.US.

question_sentence: A record $3.8 billion worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from various services last year. Some of the biggest thefts were driven by hackers linked to which country?
evidence: Some of the biggest crypto thefts were driven by North Korean-linked hackers, according to a new report. US officials worry Pyongyang will use money stolen from crypto hacks to fund its illicit nuclear and ballistic weapons program.

question_sentence: Beloved actress Cindy Williams died this week at age 75. She was best known for her role on which popular sitcom?
evidence: Cindy Williams was a dynamic actress known best for playing Shirley Feeney on “Laverne & Shirley.”

question_sentence: A tiny radioactive capsule was found in which country this week following a frantic search?
evidence: Search teams found a missing radioactive capsule, no bigger than a coin, along a road in Western Australia on Wednesday.

question_sentence: What is approximately the average age of a first-time mother in the US?
evidence: The average age of a first-time mother in the US climbed above 27 years – marking a record high – in 2021, according to a CDC report. Birth rates increased among women ages 25 to 44, while the teen birth rate reached a record low.

question_sentence: A NASA orbiter recently captured craters and formations on Mars that resembled the face of which animal?
evidence: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter used its high-resolution camera to capture craters and formations that resembled a bear’s face on Mars.

question_sentence: Workers brought which major city to a standstill this week following a second mass strike over pension reforms?
evidence: French schools and transportation networks were heavily disrupted Tuesday for the second time this month as unions staged another mass strike against government plans to raise the retirement age for most workers.

question_sentence: Which music superstar announced she will soon embark on a global tour?
evidence: Beyoncé announced her eagerly awaited “Renaissance World Tour” is coming.

A Chinese food blogger was fined the equivalent of £15,000 for eating which sea creature?

question_sentence: Novak Djokovic’s Australian Open victory this week brings his total tally of grand slam wins to how much?

question_sentence: YouTube legend MrBeast is facing criticism for doing what in his latest online stunt?
choices: Paying for 1,000 people to have cataract removal surgery
Cooking a three-course meal of roadkill for friends
Organising a mass wedding in Las Vegas
evidence: The Year of the Rabbit began on 22 January, when 15 days of worldwide celebrations kicked off. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Which film star is at the centre of a “race row” after being nominated for Best Actress at the upcoming Oscars?
evidence: The superstar singer is facing criticism from the LGBTQ+ community for accepting the gig at a hotel launch in the UAE, which has strict laws against homosexuality

question_sentence: Which “sleepy” town is the UK’s capital for Satanists, according to latest census data?
evidence: Speaking from a Florida prison, where she is serving 20 years for sex trafficking, Maxwell said she wished she had ‘never met’ her late paedophile partner Jeffrey Epstein

question_sentence: An independent review found that “too many” of which broadcaster’s journalists “lack understanding of basic economics”?
evidence: The poem, written ten years before his death, is traditionally recited as haggis is cut and served to guests at the Burns Night supper

question_sentence: 7. New research found that which UK coffee chain brews up the most caffeine-packed cappuccinos?
evidence: The Australian government is considering using a carp herpes virus to cull the invasive species, but critics says further research is needed into how other types of fish might be impacted

question_sentence: Which billionaire has fallen off Forbes’s top ten rich list following fraud allegations?
evidence: The symbolic timepiece of how close the world is to destruction now stands at 90 seconds to midnight – closer than ever before – after being moved forward 10 seconds by experts from the Bulletin of Atomic Scientists

question_sentence: Which energy giant has announced the highest profit in its 115-year history?
evidence: Jenner’s dress sparked uproar at Paris Fashion Week even though the  lion’s head was faux, with critics claiming the design and similar looks from the label’s latest collection promotes real-life ‘trophy hunting’

question_sentence: A Jewish family is suing the Guggenheim over a painting by which artist that was allegedly sold under duress during Nazi rule?
